        public static final java.util.regex.Pattern EMAIL_PATTERN

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseObject

        protected BaseObject()
        The Default constructor for BaseObject. The BaseObject constructors are private, so they can only be called from inside of a extending class. The constructor sets all default values and populates the cache for the object. Calling this constructor marks the record as new, so if save() is called the recored will be inserted into the database.
        Throws:
        ezJDOException

      • BaseObject

        protected BaseObject(java.lang.Object... keys)
        The extended constructor for BaseObject. The BaseObject constructors are private, so they can only be called from inside of a extending class. The constructor sets all default values and populates the cache for the object. Calling this constructor marks the record as not new, however this constructor does not execute a select statement. This constructor would be used to update a record by its primary id(s) without having to do a select statement first.
        Parameters:
        keys - the values of the primary keys that identify the object.
        Throws:
        ezJDOException

      • reload

        public final void reload()
                  throws ezJDOException
        Reloads all database values from the for the object. If the object is a new object this methods just calls clear(). If the record for the object was removed the object becomes a fresh new object.
        Throws:
        ezJDOException
        See Also:
        clear()

      • findMany

        protected <T extends BaseObject> Results<T> findMany(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
                                          throws ezJDOException
        Returns objects in the database from defined mappings using a "many" relationship.

        This a wrapper for findManyWhere() passing in an empty condition.

        A Many relationship is where the objects primary id(s) correspond to "many" objects from another table where that table has a matching foreign id.

        This function is protected for internal use, so when it is exposed publicly from inside of an extending class it can be wrapped in order to simplify its use. For example:

         public class DocType extends BaseObject {

     @Many(object=Document.class,column="typeId") //   And Many Docuemnts
     private Integer id;                         // <-- on primary id

     // relational function
     public Results<Document> Documents() throws ezJDOException {
         return findMany(Document.class); // mapped above
     }
 }
        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type that extends BaseObject.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class for the object you are searching for.
        Returns:
        a collection of database objects. If the search does not find any objects in the database the array list will be empty.
        Throws:
        ezJDOException
        See Also:
        findManyWhere(Class, String, Object...)

      • findManyWhere

        protected <T extends BaseObject> Results<T> findManyWhere(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                              java.lang.String conditions,
                                              java.lang.Object... values)
                                               throws ezJDOException
        Returns objects in the database from defined mappings using a "many" relationship combined with a SQL where clause.

        A Many relationship is where the objects primary id(s) correspond to "many" objects from another table where that table has a matching foreign id.

        This function is protected for internal use, so when it is exposed publicly from inside of an extending class it can be wrapped in order to simplify its use. For example:

         public class DocType extends BaseObject {

     @Many(object=Document.class,column="typeId") //   And Many Docuemnts
     private Integer id;                         // <-- on primary id

     // relational function
     public Results<Document> oldDocuments() throws ezJDOException {
         return findManyWhere(Document.class,"created < "+oldTime); // mapped above
     }
 }
        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type that extends BaseObject.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class for the object you are searching for.
        conditions - the SQL where clause conditions string.
        Returns:
        a collection of database objects. If the search does not find any objects in the database the array list will be empty.
        Throws:
        ezJDOException

      • find

        protected static <T> T find(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
         java.lang.Object... keys)
                 throws ezJDOException
        Finds a object in the database from its keys.

        This function is protected for internal use, so when it is exposed publicly from inside of an extending class it can be wrapped in order to simplify its use. For example:

         public class Document extends BaseObject {

     // wrapper for find
     public static Document find(Integer id) throws ezJDOException {
         return find(Document.class, id);
     }

     // relational function
     public DocType DocType() throws ezJDOException {
         return find(DocType.class, typeId);
         // typeId is an internal attribute for connecting the data relationship
     }
 }
        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type that you want to return.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class for the object you want the results stored in.
        keys - the key values that identify the object in the database.
        Returns:
        the database object found or a new object. If the search does not find a object in the database it just returns a new object.
        Throws:
        ezJDOException

      • find

        protected static <T> Results<T> find(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                  T example)
                          throws ezJDOException
        Finds a object in the database from example.

        This function is protected for internal use, so when it is exposed publicly from inside of an extending class it can be wrapped in order to simplify its use. For example:

         public class Document extends BaseObject {

     // wrapper for find
     public static Results<Document> find(Document example) throws ezJDOException {
         return find(Document.class, example);
     }
 }
        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type that you want to return.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class for the object you want the results stored in.
        example - the example object you will use for searching.
        Returns:
        a collection of database objects. If the search does not find any objects in the database the array list will be empty.
        Throws:
        ezJDOException

      • findWhere

        protected static <T> Results<T> findWhere(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                       java.lang.String conditions,
                       java.lang.Object... values)
                               throws ezJDOException
        Finds objects in the database from a SQL where clause.

        This function is protected for internal use, so when it is exposed publicly from inside of an extending class it can be wrapped in order to simplify its use. For example:

         public class Document extends BaseObject {

     // wrapper for findWhere
     public static Document findWhere(String conditions) throws ezJDOException {
         return findWhere(Document.class, conditions);
     }

     // relational function
     public ArrayList<Contract> Contracts() throws ezJDOException {
         return find(Contract.class, "contractNo = ?", contractNo);
         // contractNo is an internal attribute for connecting the data relationship
     }
 }
        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type that you want to return.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class for the object you want the results stored in.
        conditions - the SQL where clause conditions string.
        Returns:
        a collection of database objects. If the search does not find any objects in the database the array list will be empty.
        Throws:
        ezJDOException

      • findFirst

        protected static <T> T findFirst(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
              java.lang.String conditions,
              java.lang.Object... values)
                      throws ezJDOException
        Finds the first object in the database from a SQL where clause.

        This function is protected for internal use, so when it is exposed publicly from inside of an extending class it can be wrapped in order to simplify its use. For example:

         public class Document extends BaseObject {

     // wrapper for findFirst
     public static Document findFirst(String conditions) throws ezJDOException {
         return findFirst(Document.class, conditions);
     }

     // relational function
     public Contract firstContract() throws ezJDOException {
         return findFirst(Contract.class, "contractNo = ?", contractNo);
         // contractNo is an internal attribute for connecting the data relationship
     }
 }
        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type that you want to return.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class for the object you want the results stored in.
        conditions - the SQL where clause conditions string.
        Returns:
        the database object found or a new object. If the search does not find a object in the database it just returns a new object.
        Throws:
        ezJDOException

      • findLast

        protected static <T> T findLast(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
             java.lang.String conditions,
             java.lang.Object... values)
                     throws ezJDOException
        Finds the last object in the database from a SQL where clause.

        This function is protected for internal use, so when it is exposed publicly from inside of an extending class it can be wrapped in order to simplify its use. For example:

         public class Document extends BaseObject {

     // wrapper for findLast
     public static Document findLast(String conditions) throws ezJDOException {
         return findLast(Document.class, conditions);
     }

     // relational function
     public Contract lastContract() throws ezJDOException {
         return findLast(Contract.class, "contractNo = ?", contractNo);
         // contractNo is an internal attribute for connecting the data relationship
     }
 }
        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type that you want to return.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class for the object you want the results stored in.
        conditions - the SQL where clause conditions string.
        Returns:
        the database object found or a new object. If the search does not find a object in the database it just returns a new object.
        Throws:
        ezJDOException

      • sql

        protected static <T> Results<T> sql(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                 java.lang.String sql,
                 java.lang.Object... values)
                         throws ezJDOException
        Warning this is an advanced function that should be used carefully. Most of the time you should be able to use your find methods to get the data you need.

        this functions will issue a select statement and try to map the values back to an ArrayList of objects from the type passed.

        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type that you want to return.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class for the object you want the results stored in.
        sql - the SQL statement string.
        values - an array of values that replace the ? in the SQL statement.
        Returns:
        a collection of database objects. If the search does not find any objects in the database the array list will be empty.
        Throws:
        ezJDOException

      • sqlFirst

        protected static <T> T sqlFirst(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
             java.lang.String sql,
             java.lang.Object... values)
                     throws ezJDOException
        Warning this is an advanced function that should be used carefully. Most of the time you should be able to use your find methods to get the data you need.

        this functions will issue a sql statement and try to map the values back to a new instance of the passed object class

        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type that you want to return.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class for the object you want the results stored in.
        sql - the SQL statement string.
        values - an array of values that replace the ? in the SQL statement.
        Returns:
        the database object found or a new object. If the search does not find a object in the database it just returns a new object.
        Throws:
        ezJDOException

      • exec

        protected static <T> Results<T> exec(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                  java.lang.String sql,
                  java.lang.Object... values)
                          throws ezJDOException
        Warning this is an advanced function that should be used carefully. Most of the time you should be able to use your find methods to get the data you need.

        this functions will issue a stored procedure exec and will try to map the values back to a Results of the passed class

        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type that you want to return.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class for the object you want the results stored in.
        sql - the SQL statement string.
        values - an array of values that replace the ? in the SQL statement.
        Throws:
        ezJDOException

      • deleteAll

        protected static <T extends BaseObject> int deleteAll(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                   java.lang.String conditions,
                                   java.lang.Object... values)
                        throws ezJDOException
        Deletes all records in the table for a specific object. Warning this will remove all records, and should be used with caution.

        This function is protected for internal use, so when it is exposed publicly from inside of an extending class it can be wrapped in order to simplify its use. For example:

         public class Document extends BaseObject {

     // wrapper for deleteAll
     public static Document deleteAll() throws ezJDOException {
         return deleteAll(Document.class);
     }
 }
        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type that extends BaseObject
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class for the object you are searching for.
        Returns:
        the number of records deleted.
        Throws:
        ezJDOException
